results.title: Molecules in outer space
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Researchers”.
Radio astronomers scan the skies with the giant Parkes radio telescope in search of radio signals from molecules. They are looking for evidence pointing to the existence of life in space or to the conditions under which life forms could develop.

results.title: Zirconia: the toughest ceramic
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Researchers”.
Partially stabilized zirconia (or PSZ) is a new development in industrial ceramics and is probably the toughest ceramic ever made. Developed by researchers at CSIRO’s Division of Materials Science, PSZ has a number of unique properties which make it suitable for a variety of engineering applications.

results.title: Looking at lobsters
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Researchers”.
Describes the life cycle of the rock lobster and shows its remarkable moulting behaviour. Notes the work of marine biologists from the CSIRO and WA Department of Fisheries in learning of the factors controlling its population levels, which are crucial to the maintenance of exports.

results.title: Finding the balance: Arnhem Land
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Researchers”.
Researchers have found that the Alligator Rivers region in Arnhem Land has the richest assortment of wilflife of any comparable area known in Australia. This film documents the scientists that piece together a comprehensive picture of the fauna in this area.

results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Researchers”.
A short film which profiles the work done at the Parkes Radio Telescope in Western Australia, particularly focussing on the public display there.

results.title: Leucaena: forage for the north
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Researchers”.
Examines research by CSIRO’s Division of Tropical Crops and Pastures into leucaena, a legume native to Mexico, and its application to beef production in Northern Australia.

results.title: Better weather forecasting
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Researchers”.
The Australian Numerical Meteorological Research Centre uses high powered computers, mathematical models and information from the Bureau of Meteorology in their attempts to improve weather forecasting.

results.title: Solar power for industry
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Researchers”.
The industrial use of solar energy and its applications in a soft drink factory at Queanbeyan, NSW. A great deal of energy is used by factories. Solar industrial process heating can save a lot of the oil used to generate heat and thus help Australia aim for self-sufficiency in fuel by the turn of the century.

results.title: New twists on ocean currents
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Researchers”.
Fibreglass buoys floating in the ocean are used to track the huge ocean currents off the coast of New South Wales. The buoys are proving highly reliable in supplying insights into the so-called East Australian currents.

results.title: Cotton by computer
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Researchers”.
At Narrabri in New South Wales, CSIRO scientists are collaborating with the State Department of Agriculture and cotton farmers in the cause of more efficient production of cotton. A computer based management system is helping them find the best ways of managing the cotton crop, to use fewer pesticides and to increase the harvest.
